definition: Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
old variant of 端[duan1]/start/origin
end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular
7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Zongzi is an essential food of the Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 粽子是端午节的一个必备食品。

sentences.english: Duanwu Festival is originated in China, and was initially a day to prevent illness.
sentences.chinese: 端午节起源于中国，起初是人们以祛病防疫的节日。

sentences.english: Duanwu Festival is also called Dragon Boat Festival.
Eating Tea eggs in Nanchang Jiangxi area on the Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 吃茶蛋江西南昌地区，端午节要煮茶蛋和盐水蛋吃。

sentences.english: Dragon boat festival is also called Duanwujie.
I make some sachets of fragrant orchids and give them to my friends every Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 每年的端午节，我都会用佩兰做些香袋送给朋友。

sentences.english: I once went to the Dragon Boat Festival folk culture village to see the Dragon Boat race.
sentences.chinese: 我端午节有一次去民族文化村看到了赛龙舟。

sentences.english: Eating pancakes in Wenzhou area, on the Dragon Boat Festival every family there is the custom of eating pancakes.
sentences.chinese: 吃薄饼在温州地区，端午节家家还有吃薄饼的习俗。

sentences.english: Jimo in the Dragon Boat Festival the morning wash your face with dew.
sentences.chinese: 即墨在端午节早晨用露水洗脸。

sentences.english: Families hung wormwood and calamus on the door for the traditional Double-Fifth Festival in ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 旧时的端午节，家家户户都会在门口挂艾草，插菖蒲。

sentences.english: I enjoy drinking realgar wine during the festival.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在端午节喝点雄黄酒。

sentences.english: On Dragon Boat Festival, people put inserted moxa and calamus as one of important content.
sentences.chinese: 在端午节，人们把插艾和菖蒲作为重要内容之一。

sentences.english: Scholars may provide many other explanations about the origin of the Duanwu Festival.
sentences.chinese: 学者可以提供有关端午节的起源有许多其他的解释。

sentences.english: Eating rice dumplings and watching dragon boat races are customs during the Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 吃粽子和看划龙舟比赛是端午节的习俗。

sentences.english: Tuen Ng Festival that people eat this stuffing of rice dumplings DCB can detoxification Qubing.
sentences.chinese: 民间认为端午节吃这种馅的粽粑可以解毒去病。

definition: see 端午節|端午节[Duan1 wu3 jie2]
the Mid-Autumn Festival on 15th of 8th lunar month
Qingming or Pure Brightness Festival or Tomb Sweeping Day, celebration for the dead (in early April)
the Mid-autumn festival, the traditional moon-viewing festival on the 15th of the 8th lunar month
International Labor Day (May Day)
PRC National Day (October 1st)

Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
Double Ninth or Yang Festival/9th day of 9th lunar month

Qixi Festival or Double Seven Festival on the 7th day of the 7th lunar month/girls' festival/Chinese Valentine's day, when Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女[niu2 lang3 zhi1 nu:3] are allowed their annual meeting
Ghost Festival on 15th day of 7th lunar month when offerings are made to the deceased

to race dragon boats
